content.description: Wandering route up the path of least resistance, three variations exist.  Follow flaring crack systems to top.  Poor gear placements and moderate climbing.  This one will scare you if it's near your limit, but is fun for experienced trad leaders.  NO TOP ANCHOR BOLTS, build a belay anchor with cams to 4".
content.location: Near left end of Auto Shop, look for the path of least resistance up a generally left-leaning ramp.

content.description: Flaring chimney just left of Discount Muffler.  Easy/moderate climbing in narrow chimney, difficult gear placement.  Two-bolt top anchor lines up perfectly for top rope.
content.protection: Gear to Big Bro #4, two bolt top anchor
content.location: Look through opening in the brush, right off of the Stairway Loop Trail along Auto Shop wall.

content.description: Follow grey water streak up past a bolt (15' up) and onto a thin ledge.  Move up and right to a small hidden crack that takes small cams.  Continue over bulge to two-bolt rappel anchor.  Crux is clearing the upper bulge, and can be avoided by climbing up a 5.6 mantle to the left.
content.protection: Gear and cams to 3", one bolt.
content.location: On left end of Auto Shop Wall, left of a large pine tree and behind a small oak.

climbs.name: Discount Mufler
climbs.fa: Kevin Keith, Luke Wakefield and Bill Cramer

content.description: This route requires steep face climbing past bolts to a horizontal crack that takes some finger sized cams or larger. A steep boulder problem above is bolt protected. The crux is somewhere around the second bolt if you don't stem back to the large flake like arete to the left several feet.
content.protection: 4 bolts and small to medium cams
content.location: Along the Stairway Loop it is the obvious steep face with several bolts.

climbs.name: Chutes and Ladders
climbs.fa: Kevin Keith, Luke Wakefield, Bill Cramer

content.description: This is a fun route, and easy to set up as a top rope.  There are two distinct cruxes.  One at the bottom and one at the top.  The cruxes are both protected pretty well with bolts.  It is a little runout at the top.  There is some gear available in the middle of the route.  I think the (r) rating is for the moves getting up to clip the top bolt.  If you approach the clip from the left, I think it is pretty moderate (5.7?).  I found this move to be exposed,  though  not too scary.  If you approach the clip from the right, I think it is difficult (5.10?) and scary.  You can get some gear in about 10 feet below the top bolt.  Good route, and easy to tr if you are unsure about leading it!
content.protection: 2 bolts, small regular rack, bolted anchor
content.location: This is currently the farthest right route on the auto shop wall.  Look for a low bolt and a high bolt.  An easy curving ramp between the two bolts.  About 20 feet to the right of: discount muffler.

content.description: Sunny south facing wall along the Stairway Loop Trail about 300' uphill from the Driftwood Wall.
